skill.name: venue-templates
skill.description: Access comprehensive LaTeX templates, formatting requirements, and submission guidelines for major scientific publication venues (Nature, Science, PLOS, IEEE, ACM), academic conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, CHI), research posters, and grant proposals (NSF, NIH, DOE, DARPA). This skill should be used when preparing manuscripts for journal submission, conference papers, research posters, or grant proposals and need venue-specific formatting requirements and templates.
skill.summary: Access comprehensive LaTeX templates, formatting requirements, and submission guidelines for major s...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 791 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanner incorrectly flagged: (1) Markdown backticks as shell commands across 400 locations in documentation files; (2) LaTeX formatting commands (\textbf, \section, \cite) as cryptographic algorithms across 300+ locations in template files; (3) Documentation URLs to journal websites as hardcoded URLs; (4) PDF validation utility calls (pdfinfo, pdffonts) as external commands; (5) Help text mentioning 'sudo apt-get' as privilege escalation. This is a legitimate academic template repository with no security risks.

content.user_title: Format academic papers with venue-specific templates
content.value_statement: Academic publishing requires strict formatting compliance. This skill provides ready-to-use LaTeX templates and detailed requirements for 50+ top journals, conferences, and grant agencies. Get perfectly formatted documents without manual template hunting.
actual_capabilities: Access 50+ LaTeX templates for major journals and conferences
Generate venue-specific formatting requirements and guidelines
Customize templates with author information and project details
Validate document compliance against venue specifications
Provide writing style guides for different academic disciplines
limitations: Requires LaTeX installation for template compilation
Templates may need updates for latest venue guidelines
PDF validation depends on external tools (poppler-utils)
Manual verification still recommended for final submissions

use_cases.title: Format thesis or first publication
use_cases.description: Use Nature or Science templates with built-in formatting requirements to prepare manuscripts for high-impact journals without learning LaTeX from scratch.

use_cases.title: Meet conference deadlines quickly
use_cases.description: Access NeurIPS, ICML, or CVPR templates with exact formatting specs to focus on research content instead of formatting details.

use_cases.title: Prepare compliant grant proposals
use_cases.description: Use NSF, NIH, or DOE templates with specific requirements like page limits, margins, and required sections already configured.

prompt_templates.title: Find journal template
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to submit to specific journal
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to submit a paper to Nature Methods. Show me the template and formatting requirements including page limits, citation style, and figure requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Compare venues
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the formatting requirements and page limits for NeurIPS vs ICML 2025 submissions.

prompt_templates.title: Grant proposal format
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to write an NSF CAREER proposal. Show me the required sections, page limits, and provide a template with proper formatting.

prompt_templates.title: Validate submission
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a completed paper for PLOS ONE. Validate that it meets all formatting requirements including page count, fonts, and margins.

output_examples.input: I need to submit to Nature and need the template and requirements
output: - Figures: 300+ dpi resolution, RGB or CMYK color
- No page charges for first 5 pages

output_examples.input: What are the NeurIPS 2025 formatting requirements?
output: - Page limit: 8 pages main text + unlimited references/appendix
- Supplementary: Separate PDF with unlimited pages

output_examples.input: Show me NSF proposal template with page limits
output: - Project Summary: 1 page (Overview, Intellectual Merit, Broader Impacts)
- Biographical Sketch: 3 pages per senior personnel

best_practices: Always verify current requirements on official venue websites before final submission
Test compile templates before adding content to ensure LaTeX packages are installed
Use the validation script to check compliance before submission deadlines
anti_patterns: Don't modify venue-specific formatting like margins or fonts - this can cause desk rejection
Don't ignore supplementary material requirements - check if they are included in page limits
Don't use outdated templates - always check the template date against current guidelines

faq.question: Do I need LaTeX installed to use these templates?
faq.answer: Yes, you need a LaTeX distribution like TeX Live or MiKTeX to compile templates. The skill provides templates and requirements, but compilation happens locally.

faq.question: Are these templates official from the venues?
faq.answer: Templates are based on official guidelines but may not be the latest. Always verify against current author instructions on official venue websites before submission.

faq.question: Can I use these for any journal or conference?
faq.answer: The skill covers 50+ major venues across disciplines. If your target venue is not included, you can request additions or use similar venue templates as a starting point.

faq.question: How often are templates updated?
faq.answer: Templates are updated annually or when venues release new guidelines. Check the template date and verify against current requirements before use.

faq.question: What if the validation script finds issues?
faq.answer: Validation provides guidance but is not definitive. Use it as a pre-submission check, then manually verify all requirements before final submission.

faq.question: Can I modify the templates extensively?
faq.answer: Stick to content replacement only. Do not change formatting elements like margins, fonts, or spacing - venues require strict adherence to their specifications.
